message_1: Given the Caesar cipher with shift value 3, encrypt the plaintext "MATHISFUN" and find the corresponding ciphertext. Then, use cryptanalysis to find the original plaintext from the given ciphertext "PDWLOLVIXQ".
message_2:
To encrypt the plaintext "MATHISFUN" using a Caesar cipher with a shift value of 3, we shift each letter in the plaintext 3 positions forward in the alphabet. If the shift goes beyond 'Z', it wraps around to the beginning of the alphabet.

M -> P
A -> D
T -> W
H -> K
I -> L
S -> V
F -> I
U -> X
N -> Q

So, the encrypted ciphertext is "PDWKLVIUXQ".

Now, to decrypt the given ciphertext "PDWLOLVIXQ" using cryptanalysis, we will reverse the Caesar cipher by shifting each letter 3 positions backward in the alphabet.

P -> M
D -> A
W -> T
L -> I
O -> L
V -> S
I -> F
X -> U
Q -> N

The decrypted plaintext is "MATHISFUN".
